alert.note: Alert for Berks; Lehigh; Upper Bucks; Western Chester; Western Montgomery (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 12 at 4:09AM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A line of showers with strong winds will impact portions of eastern Berks, Lehigh, northwestern Montgomery, northwestern Bucks, north central Chester and Northampton Counties through 445 AM EST... At 407 AM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a line of showers with a history of producing strong winds extending from Slatington to near Sinking Spring. Reading Regional Airport recently measured a 39 mph wind gust with these showers. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Allentown, Reading, Easton, Bethlehem, Pottstown, Forks, Emmaus, Wyomissing, Northampton, Wilson, Hellertown, Nazareth, Birdsboro, Kutztown, Slatington, Fleetwood, Sinking Spring, Laureldale, East Greenville and Wind Gap. This includes the following highways... Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 295 and 312. Northeast Extension between mile markers 41 and 71. Interstate 78 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 39 and 76. Interstate 176 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 1 and 11. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Berks; Lehigh; Upper Bucks; Western Chester; Western Montgomery
